question: Which of the following is the main objective of scheduling?
Which type of scheduling ensures that no process has to wait too long?
What is the main disadvantage of First Come First Served (FCFS) scheduling?
options: It can result in long waiting times for short processes

question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Non-preemptive scheduling?
options: The CPU can switch from one process to another at any time
Once a process starts, it is not interrupted
The process with the shortest remaining time is always selected
The scheduler decides based on priorities

question: What is the purpose of the wait command in a scheduling algorithm?
options: To pause execution for a set amount of time
To allow a process to wait until another process finishes

question: Which scheduling algorithm uses the shortest job first to minimize turnaround time?
What is the key feature of Shortest Remaining Time Next (SRTN)?
options: It is a non-preemptive scheduling algorithm
It selects the task with the shortest remaining time
It ensures fairness by assigning equal time slices

question: Which scheduling algorithm assigns fixed time slots to each process?
Which of the following is true about Priority Scheduling?
options: Processes with the highest priority are executed first
It does not handle starvation issues
It uses a time slice for each process

question: What is the main advantage of Round Robin (RR) scheduling?
options: It ensures fairness by giving each process a fixed time slice
It always prioritizes the shortest tasks

question: Which of the following scheduling algorithms is preemptive?
In which scheduling algorithm does the process with the shortest execution time run first?
What happens in Multilevel Queue Scheduling when a higher-priority queue has a process to run?
options: It preempts all processes in lower-priority queues
It waits for the lower-priority queues to finish
It runs with the round-robin scheduling in the lower queue
It uses First Come First Served (FCFS) in the lower queue

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of Shortest Job First (SJF) scheduling?
options: It causes starvation of long tasks
It is fair to all processes

question: Which scheduling algorithm is best for ensuring fairness in resource allocation?
What happens when a process in Round Robin (RR) exceeds its time slice?
options: The process moves to the back of the queue
The process gets priority for the next round

question: Which scheduling algorithm guarantees that no process is interrupted before it completes?
What is the primary disadvantage of Priority Scheduling?
options: It results in starvation of low-priority processes
It is not suitable for long tasks
It uses time slices for each process

question: Which scheduling algorithm can lead to starvation if low-priority tasks never get executed?
In which scheduling algorithm is the task with the shortest remaining time always executed next?
Which of the following scheduling algorithms is non-preemptive?
Which scheduling algorithm ensures that each process gets an equal opportunity to execute?
In a multilevel queue scheduling system, which queue is the lowest priority?
options: All queues have the same priority

question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Round Robin (RR) scheduling?
options: It uses a fixed time slice
It does not use time slices
It always completes tasks in the shortest time

question: Which of the following is a feature of Shortest Job First (SJF)?
options: It executes the shortest job first
It uses a fixed time slice

question: What is the main disadvantage of SRTN (Shortest Remaining Time Next)?
Which scheduling algorithm prioritizes the task with the shortest processing time?
Which scheduling algorithm is best for systems where all processes should be executed fairly?
Which scheduling algorithm is designed to prevent starvation by aging?
Which scheduling method uses multiple queues for organizing processes based on priority?
What is a key advantage of using Round Robin (RR) scheduling in a time-sharing system?
options: It ensures fairness among all processes

question: In which scheduling algorithm does the CPU switch from one task to another only when the current task finishes?
What is a common issue with Priority Scheduling that can be mitigated using aging?
Which scheduling method is the most complex due to its multiple queues?
Which of the following scheduling algorithms could lead to a task never being executed?
What does the 'starvation' problem refer to in scheduling algorithms?
options: Short tasks are always executed first
Long tasks may never execute due to lower priority
The system halts due to excessive context switching
The scheduler uses all CPU cycles without any idle time

question: Which scheduling algorithm is best suited for tasks that require real-time execution?
What happens in SRTN when a shorter task arrives during the execution of a longer task?
options: The CPU continues running the longer task
The shorter task interrupts the longer task
The scheduler waits for the longer task to finish

question: Which scheduling algorithm uses a time slice to allocate CPU time equally to processes?
Which of the following is true for Multilevel Queue Scheduling?
options: It uses a single queue for all processes
It allows processes to move between queues
Each queue uses a different scheduling algorithm
All queues have the same priority

question: Which scheduling algorithm executes tasks with the shortest processing time first?
Which of the following is true for Shortest Remaining Time Next (SRTN)?
options: It always gives the highest priority to long tasks
It can preempt tasks that are already running
It uses time slices for each process

question: What is the key advantage of Priority Scheduling?
options: Processes with shorter jobs run first

question: Which scheduling algorithm might result in low-priority tasks being indefinitely delayed?
What is one of the main disadvantages of using Round Robin (RR) scheduling with a very small time slice?
options: It leads to inefficient context switching
It ensures that every process gets completed quickly

question: Which scheduling algorithm uses priorities but allows processes with the highest priority to be executed first?
In Priority Scheduling, what is the issue when lower-priority tasks never execute?
Which of the following algorithms is best for short tasks but may suffer with long tasks?
What is a benefit of using a multilevel queue in scheduling?
options: It gives more CPU time to background processes
It organizes tasks based on their priority levels

question: Which scheduling algorithm is designed for tasks with varying lengths and priorities?
